intro: Marginaria ciliata, commonly known as the silky sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. Marginaria ciliata is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots and succulent leaves that help store water.
